intro: Heteromorpha andohahelensis, commonly known as the Madagascar orchid, is a rare and endemic species native to Madagascar. It belongs to the orchid family, Orchidaceae, and is characterized by its unique floral structure and vibrant colors. The plant typically grows in shaded, humid environments, often in forest understories. Its flowers are highly specialized, with intricate petal arrangements that aid in pollination by specific insect species. Due to habitat loss and limited distribution, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
